There is a workaround involving aligned grids: https://plnkr.co/edit/ZgwYmQ3HGDTuWB3U?open=main.js
By stacking two grids on top of each other you can display two horizontal scrollbars. You'll need to add user code to wire up the column events between the top grid (showing the column headers only) and the bottom grid (showing data rows only). Specifically, you'll need to ensure that whenever a column is sorted/filtered in the top grid, the same operation is performed to the bottom grid.

summary: [Integrated] Allow maximizing the Integrated Charts programmatically on chart creation
[Accessibility] Allow editable grid cells to be announced as editable when using a callback
moreInformation:
Until this is implemented as built-in, you can customize AG Grid to add the appropriate accessibility-related attributes to announce grid cells in editable columns as editable.

Please see this here:
1. Open
[https://plnkr.co/edit/nVb7yNJ0iWInHrgW?open=main.js|https://plnkr.co/edit/nVb7yNJ0iWInHrgW?open=main.js]
2. Open NVDA
3. Click a cell in the ATHLETE column (not editable column)
Actual & Expected: Cell value announced, no "editable" announcement 
4. Press the RIGHT ARROW key to focus a cell in the AGE column (editable column)
Actual & Expected: Cell value announced with "editable" announcement 

In order to generate the announcement, we're using a custom cell editor for the editable columns which modifies the accessibility attribute (aria-description) of the parent cell. 

Please use the same approach to implement this in your project.

[SSRM] Allow restoring the page index when using pagination in SSRM
moreInformation:
Navigating to a page index when restoring grid state has some edge cases that are hard to support, specifically when using row grouping and paginating child rows. This is why restoring the page index wasn't implemented as built-in for the server-side row model (SSRM).

However, you can easily implement this when not using row grouping by setting the grid property serverSideInitialRowCount to a number larger than the row count value. In this example we’re setting it to  Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER to ensure it works for all rowcount values. In this example, I'm applying initial state to immediately open page 3.

Steps:
1. Open https://plnkr.co/edit/kBvxIzOWgYu1VB3D?open=main.js
Actual & Expected: Grid shows page index 3
2. Open console
Actual & Expected: Console message shows grid makes only one request - specifically for the rows shown on page index 3

[Updating Data] Allow keeping the current visible rows unchanged as new rows are added above due to background operations (transactions) (keep the same rows in view as the scrolling position changes)
moreInformation:
The sample below tracks the row at the top of the viewport except if the scrollbar is at the top of the grid.

1. Open https://plnkr.co/edit/hwmYndXvuAq1I1Ya?open=main.js
2. Click START FEED button
3. Wait 3 seconds for a new row to be added
Actual & Expected: Grid remains scrolled at the top, new rows shown as soon as they're added
4. Scroll down so you have row with Make=FORD at the top of the viewport (ensure it's fully visible even if a bit of the row above it is shown)
5. Wait 3 seconds for a new row to be added
Actual & Expected: Grid scrolls to ensure row with Make=FORD remains at the top of the viewport. Scrollbar thumb gets smaller to reflect the increasing number of rows in the grid

Please note:
1/ this example assumes all your rows have the same height. If you have rows of different height, you'll have to enumerate them and add up the total heights instead.
2/ animateRows is false, turning off row animation. This is important to prevent the grid viewport from animating slightly each time it scrolls after a new row is added
3/ This workaround only supports synchronous transactions. If you're using async transactions, please consider switching to sync transactions to use this approach.

There are many scrolling scenarios in the grid which can be achieved using the grid API. We've demonstrated this scenario. If you need further adjustments, please use the API to implement this on your side based on this example.

summary: [API] Rename API members related to tool panels to use 'expand' instead of 'open' and 'collapse' instead of 'close'
[Layout & Styling] Allow grid rows to render as list items/cards to support narrower screens on mobile devices
moreInformation:
AG Grid doesn't have a built-in mobile layout. Until this is provided as built-in, you can configure AG Grid to adapt its appearance to the requirements of a mobile UI and you can implement some of the features with user code.
 
You can implement this as a custom solution in the following way:
1/ Hide grid header (by setting gridOptions.headerHeight=0)
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/grid-options/#reference-headers-headerHeight
2/ (if you need a filter) Add a search button above the grid which opens the quick filter - this way users search across all columns, which is more appropriate for mobile users instead of the traditional column-based filters
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/filter-quick/
3/ (if you need to control column visibility) Add your own column visibility UI via an external button to open the column chooser:
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/grid-api/#reference-accessories-showColumnChooser
4/ Add a button to export the grid (if needed, though unlikely on a mobile device) by calling the export API method
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/grid-api/#reference-export-exportDataAsExcel
5/ Customize grid rows to use a full-width row showing all the column values (for the visible columns). This way the grid will have a single column showing full-width rows, where in the full-width row template you can provide HTML to display different column values of that row in a vertical format (just like in the syncfusion example).
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/full-width-rows/
6/ The column values shown in each row can be customized using the column chooser. 
 
I've implemented this approach here with points 1,2,3,5,6 (only for columns POPULATION and AREA) from list above:
1. Open https://plnkr.co/edit/NSlr8AWEgLAfLKtC?open=main.js
2. Search in quick filter - it only searches columns listed in the columnDefs list
3. Click the button above the grid and toggle the visible columns - note the corresponding columns values are show/removed from grid rows
 
This is a custom approach and relies on user code but is the only approach available at this point to achieve the kind of mobile experience you're looking for.

moreInformation:
You can implement this in particular scenarios with user code as shown here:

Here's an example showing many columns in the unpinned columns area - they are auto-sized to fit as many columns as possible within the limited width:
https://plnkr.co/edit/cCqf98vRn42J6xZR?open=main.js
Here's the same example showing only a few columns - note the unpinned column is stretched out to fill the grid space so it doesn't leave any whitespace between the unpinned columns and the pinned columns on the right:
https://plnkr.co/edit/NnjsKZpNDUzyXaCQ?open=main.js

This approach will not work for all scenarios - for example it doesn't work if you resize the grid. Please adapt this code to suit your needs. The approach is the following call autoSizeColumns when creating the grid, and if there is still empty space available in the unpinned columns viewport call sizeColumnsToFit to stretch out columns to avoid whitespace.

We hope you can use this approach to implementing this until this is provided as a standard feature by the grid.

moreInformation:
Until this is implemented, you can use the approach below. ENTER is only used for starting cell editing, while SPACE is only used for toggling group levels.
The approach uses the following:
1/ suppresses all default actions for the Enter key with suppressKeyboardEvent
2/ uses onCellKeyDown to add a custom behavior - start cell edit on Enter and the Expand/Collapse the group row with the Space key. 

See this approach shown in this example:
https://plnkr.co/edit/2SNr6plh2G5uUqXO?open=main.ts

moreInformation:
Limited Workaround for Selecting Rows on Current Page

There is a limited workaround available for specific scenarios to select values on the current page when using SSRM with paging. 

It requires the following settings in gridOptions:
maxBlocksInCache:1,
rowBuffer needs to be equal to paginationPageSize
cacheBlockSize value needs to be a factor of paginationPageSize value, less than paginationPageSize value

1. Open https://plnkr.co/edit/B5tw0qeirl6Opw5b?open=main.js
2. Move to page 2
3. Click SELECT THIS PAGE button
4. Move to page 3
5. Click the GET SELECTED ROWS button
Actual & Expected: Console shows selected rows
6. Move to last page
7. Click the GET SELECTED ROWS button
Actual & Expected: Console shows selected rows
8. Move to first page
9. Click the GET SELECTED ROWS button
Actual & Expected: Console shows selected rows
10. Move to second page
Actual & Expected: Rows shown as selected
11. Click the GET SELECTED ROWS button
Actual & Expected: Console shows selected rows

moreInformation:
You can show a grand total row as a pinned row whose values are updated dynamically on each server request: 
https://plnkr.co/edit/KBtFusktzWfzI4OE?open=main.js
 
Example explained: 
The 'fakeServer.js', includes a function getTotalSum which will calculate totals for the TOTAL column 
Once data is returned from the server, the getRows callback uses gridApi.setGridOption to update the pinnedBottomRowData to set the total value in the pinned row
 
Here is a test case to validate the expected behaviour: 
1. Enter '6' into the TOTAL filter 
Actual & Expected: 3 rows displayed and correct total column value '18' displayed in the grand total row
2. Enter 'Michael Phelps' into the ATHLETE filter 
Actual & Expected: 1 row is displayed with a total column value '6' in the grand total row

moreInformation:
This behaviour was originally also reported on CSRM. The observed behaviour is: 

Open: https://plnkr.co/edit/KhTKJjSYdr67KreA?open=main.js, note that group column is sorted DESC (descending)
Click the TASK column header cell to sort it

Observed: 
1/ Tasks sorted but only within groups
2/ Row groups not reordered (earlier row order preserved)
3/ Sort indicator cleared from group columns (ASSIGNEE), group column removed from sortModel

Noted:

1/ This is virtually confusing as the group columns aren’t sorted anymore, but the previous sort order is preserved. 
2/ This also removes the group columns from the sort model, which prevents returning to the same row order later.

This is as expected because Group Order is not the same as sorting as per Kiril's comment below.

summary: [Clipboard] Allow pasting cell ranges into cell ranges which include group rows
moreInformation:
Until this is implemented, you can set enableGroupEdit=true to enable paste inside group rows.

Steps:
1. Open https://plnkr.co/edit/TaBhl4IcCC5yguGJ?open=main.js
2. Select cell range containing 6 rows in the GOLD column - 8, 1, (blank), 6 (blank), 4
3. Press CTRL+C
4. Focus a range of equivalent height starting with the SILVER column cell in the second row
5. Paste
Actual & Expected: cell range containing 6 rows in the GOLD column - 8, 1, (blank), 6 (blank), 4 is pasted

Please note the enableGroupEdit property makes group row cells editable. This means that by default end-users can edit the group row cells manually and set values. However, this is undesirable, so I've added the onCellEditingStarted event handler code to stop editing for group row cells. This means that you can still edit leaf row (non-group row) cells, and you can paste in the group row cells but not edit the group row cells manually.

[Aggregation] Allow selecting multiple aggregations on the same column and dragging multiple instances of the same value column to the value panel so it can be aggregated with different aggregation functions
moreInformation:
At this time, you can only show multiple aggregations in the same column using a custom aggregation function which returns a complex object containing the results of each aggFunc. You also need a custom cell renderer to show the complex object aggregated results on multiple lines in the column:
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/aggregation-custom-functions/#custom-aggregation-functions

At this time, the user can't select more than one aggregation function in the column menu, so you have to add your custom UI outside of the grid to help the user select which aggregations are displayed.

Here's an implementation of this approach for the non-pivoting case. It displays multiple aggregation values for a column in the same cell:
https://plnkr.co/edit/beq1vPjCYIj1l7DR?open=main.js

moreInformation:
You can implement this as follows - in the nodeClick event params you can access the data of the clicked chart marker. In the data object, you need to add a property to store the unique row ID value and return this unique row ID in the getRowId callback. Then, when a user clicks a chart marker, can then find the corresponding row using the getRowNode API method.

Please see this approach shown here (using the country property to store the unique row ID values):
https://plnkr.co/edit/REjlcQPHycA7TBlX

Click a chart marker to select the grid row that contains the data shown by this marker.

moreInformation:
If you adjust your backend response to contain the total values as the first column in every group, you can use the implementation below. 

This uses the processPivotResultColGroupDef callback to only show the first column in any pivot column group, and shows all of the columns when expanding the pivot column group:
1. Open https://plnkr.co/edit/HOzgHs5CWamKMSSM?open=main.js&preview
2. Expand SWIMMING pivot column group
Actual & Expected: All sub-groups under SWIMMING pivot column group shown each showing sum(gold) aggregated column
3. Expand SWIMMING > 17 pivot column group
Actual & Expected: sum(gold), sum(silver), sum(bronze) columns shown

Please note that each pivot column group is showing sum(gold) aggregated column when collapsed. If you'd like to show a total column instead, please provide it as the first column on each level to ensure that it's shown when the pivot column group is collapsed.

summary: [Pivoting] Allow displaying a total column for all pivot column groups (currently only showing a total column for groups with more than one child column) when setting pivotColumnGroupTotals
[Accessibility] Allow the focused item to be clearly visible when using Windows high-contrast themes
moreInformation:
There's a way to detect in CSS whether there's a high-contrast mode and apply alternative styles to AG Grid on the fly. This is an application-level concern as you'll be applying the same approach to make the rest of your application styling respond to high-contrast theme.
 
Please see the example below - it demonstrates how to detect high-contrast mode and set some CSS variables used in AG Grid to adjust the styling.
1. Set high-contrast theme mode
2. Open https://plnkr.co/edit/7rDEhMQ5TwUrE4hR?preview
3. Hover a row - row is highlighted
4. Right-click a grid cell, navigate inside the context menu - menu items are highlighted
5. Open a column menu, navigate inside it - menu items are highlighted
6. Focus a cell - the highlighted cell border is shown
 
Please work with your developers to further adjust the AG Grid CSS variables applying to the features you're using to ensure they show the highlighted style in high-contrast mode.

moreInformation:
Until this is implemented you can build this as follows - when the RTL mode changes, toggle the pinned column direction (from right to left and vice versa) and regenerate the grid as implemented in this example:
https://plnkr.co/edit/W4KDL4VzJ84p2jAR?open=main.js

In this sample you have the ATHLETE column pinned left and TOTAL pinned right with RTL=false. 
Click the button above the grid to set RTL=true. This will render the grid in RTL mode and move the ATHLETE pinned column to the right edge, and move the TOTAL column to the left edge.

[Layout & Styling] Allow using custom React/Vue components as icons
moreInformation:
It is possible to supply a custom icon that is a function returning a DOM node. You can use React to render a custom icon component, then use this rendered component as a template for the icon, cloning the template when required. 

Here is a plunker illustrating that: https://plnkr.co/edit/UB8Y1LVf00EeE0IE?open=index.jsx&preview
 
Note that once the custom icon component has been cloned then it will no longer update when the template changes, meaning that it can't be interactive or make updates in response to data. However the technique will work well with simple static React components that just render DOM and use CSS styling.

moreInformation: Accessibility scanners detect the fact that checkboxes inside set filter items aren't focusable as an accessibility failure. However, this is only based on static DOM analysis and isn't an actual failure because AG Grid implements its own custom keyboard navigation to toggle the checkbox when the user works with the set filter item. This is why this is will be flagged as an issue by accessibility tests but not be an issue in practice.

[Layout & Styling] Allow removing the focused styling from the selected cell range when grid loses focus
moreInformation:
When the grid is using range selection and a cell range is selected, clicking outside of the grid displays the currently selected cell range in the grid with selected style. This behavior is correct as it allows you to add your external UI (buttons) outside of the grid to process the selected cell range in the grid. The cell range appears shaded in the grid and provides a visual indication to the user which cells will be affected by any externally triggered action. This is why when range selection is enabled the selected range remains visible when you the grid loses focus.

One of the ways to override this default behavior is to remove the selected range when the grid loses focus. You can implement this as follows:
https://plnkr.co/edit/gudoSOnd5agD6XEs

moreInformation:
Until this is resolved, please use a custom sort comparator as shown below: 
https://plnkr.co/edit/SIUjgo4wwNZazk49

The sort comparator in the sample above sorts NaN values using the following order: nulls -> NaNs -> numbers -> characters. You can modify it to treat NaN values according to your specific requirements.

AG Grid correctly adds the accessibility-related attributes aria-colindex and aria-colspan attributes to the grouped column DOM elements. However, JAWS and NVDA are not following the path correctly and are using their own heustics to navigate the DOM tree. This is why they generate the wrong announcement.

Please note that Windows Narrator works correctly and makes the correct announcement.

We've filed this as an issue with JAWS: https://github.com/FreedomScientific/VFO-standards-support/issues/401

moreInformation:
Until this is implemented as a built-in feature, you can add this with user code. 

When the grid calls getRows, it is important to either call the success or fail callback per request, however as these are callbacks you can delay or debounce your response as long as is needed.
 
Using this logic you can implement this behaviour fairly simply, and leave the grid in a loading state until your application is ready to respond to the getRows request.
 
See the following example to demonstrate this:
1. Open
v29.3 https://plnkr.co/edit/gIw702242ZMOAwki?open=main.js
v32.1 https://plnkr.co/edit/52EJGAF0LsWUHsOp?open=main.js
2. Change the pivoted/aggregated/grouped columns
Actual & Expected: Grid is in loading state, no request to server made
3. Click button above grid
Actual & Expected: Server request made, grid loads data

Note no matter what changes you make to the pivoted/grouped columns, it doesn't reload any data until you click the refresh button.

summary: [Columns Tool Panel] Allow hiding the column drag handle in the columns tool panel when suppressMovable=true or functionsReadOnly=true
[SSRM] When using SSRM with paging, allow pre-fetching data for the next page of records, so user doesn't have to see the loading indicators when they open a new page
moreInformation:
You can implement this when using server-side row model with infinite scrolling using the approach described below. 

If you have a block size of 200 and want to start loading the next block (with rows 200-400) as soon as the user is scrolling past row index 100, you need to set rowBuffer=100. This way when the user is at row 101, the grid is instantiating row 201, and as that's outside of the data for the current block 0-200, that forces a request for a new block of data (with data for rows 200-400).

See this implemented here:
Infinite row model - https://plnkr.co/edit/MR8mzfOAQkrGsS5s?preview
Server-side row model - https://plnkr.co/edit/gEa4EdlRbVN8cjmo

See the messages in the developer console indicating the second block of data is loaded much earlier as the user is scrolling, so the user doesn't see loading indicators unless they scroll really fast. If that's the case, just increase the value of cacheBlockSize to load larger chunks of data at a time to accommodate that.

[Accessibility] Allow screen reader to read correct column names when using pinned columns
moreInformation:
This is caused by the fact that the pinned columns aren’t rendered in sequence with un-pinned columns. This is throwing off the screen readers who expect that elements that are visually adjacent are adjacent in the DOM structure. 

1. Open https://plnkr.co/edit/C7dOOVJOYTpwgNh7?open=main.js
2. Open NVDA
3. Focus top-left grid cell (pinned column)
Actual & Expected: Announcement - Natalie Coughlin row header row 3 athlete age column 1
4. Press RIGHT ARROW key to focus AGE column cell in top row
Actual: Announcement - 25 row 33 athlete age column 2

AG Grid actually generates aria properties with the correct values to identify these cells as belonging to the same row - if you inspect the top-left cell in the browser you'll see that its row element (in the left-pinned columns container) has aria-rowindex="2", just like the top cell in the AGE column. 

However, JAWS and NVDA don't read these property values - instead they use their own heuristics to count rows and generate an incorrect announcement because these are separate DOM elements representing rows (one inside the pinned container, one in the unpinned container), even though they're labelled as belonging to the same logical and visual row with aria-rowindex="2". This is why this is a screen reader issue as AG Grid correctly labels the rows across the pinned and unpinned containers to indicate they are in fact the same row.

This is documented as a known limitation here:
https://www.ag-grid.com/vue-data-grid/accessibility/#navigation-to-pinned-rowscolumns

summary: [Column Group] Allow hiding all columns in a column group through the column group itself, as opposed to all the individual child columns
moreInformation:
You can't set visibility explicitly on a group column - a group column is only shown if any of its child columns are visible. This is why you can't hide a column group directly. In order to hide it, you need to hide all its child columns instead. 

You can do this by calling columnApi.setColumnVisible(false) on the child columns or by applying column state.

Steps to illustrate:
0. Open
https://plnkr.co/edit/3f3x4NEznDsdVuIf?open=main.js
1. Group by COUNTRY column
2. Click SAVE STATE button
3. Click the button above grid to hide ATHLETE column
Actual & Expected: Group column hidden
4. Click RESTORE STATE button
Actual & Expected: Group column shown

1/ While in Korean/Japanese Hiragana input mode, select a cell, press the F2 or ENTER key to start editing, and you can enter Korean/Japanese text normally
2/ Activate single click edit mode in AG Grid so clicking a cell will enter edit mode automatically so the Korean/Japanese text will be entered normally:
https://www.ag-grid.com/javascript-data-grid/cell-editing-start-stop/#single-click-editing

See this implemented in example below.

Steps to illustrate:
1. Open
https://plnkr.co/edit/KRdCninBAWrlA8GK?open=main.js
2. Switch to Japanese-Hiragana language mode
3. Click any cell
Actual & Expected: Cell enters edit mode
3. Type 'aa'
Actual & Expected: Cell value is ああ

[Typing] Add typings filterModel
moreInformation:
== filterModel typing ==
We do not type gridApi.setFilterModel() as the filter can be a custom filter, for which we don't (can't) have typings for, so the model MUST be any. For specific filters we provide, then the interface needs to be referenced independently (eg use NumberFilterModel for Number Filter).

With regards the type (lessThan, greaterThan etc) again the application can provide custom types, which blocks us for making this an enum.

[SSRM][Row Height] Allow navigating to row index (by calling ensureIndexVisible API method) and restoring scroll location to work with row auto height (or dynamic row height)
moreInformation:
The easiest way to resolve this is to suppress row virtualization. This means the grid will size all rows and will know how far down to scroll exactly to bring a specific row into view. However this only works for client-side row model and even then is only applicable when you have a small number of rows shown in the grid as you'd like to avoid a larger initial rendering time.

So unless you've suppressed row virtualization (and loaded all data from the server), the grid doesn't know how tall the rows are until it scrolls them into view and sizes them, at which point the row you scrolled into view (or scrolled to by calling ensureIndexVisible API) may be pushed out of view because the rows above it have larger height.

You can address this by calling the ensureIndexVisible method multiple times separated by a short delay:
(server-side row model) https://plnkr.co/edit/9kjBEWawsxuFn5di?open=main.js

See examples below for client-side and server-side row models which display an overlay while the grid is scrolling, so the user doesn't see the multiple scrolls happening:
(server-side row model) https://plnkr.co/edit/lUnJxPbBR8kLT1ea?open=main.js
(client-side row model) https://plnkr.co/edit/NFK4JZHlP5A24Oya?open=main.js

The delay between the calls to ensureIndexVisible allows the auto-height computation logic to run for the visible rows to set their height. This approach then keeps calling the ensureIndexVisible method as many times as necessary until the scrolling settles, which means all rows have sized themselves and no more scrolling is necessary to bring the desired row into view.

Please adjust the delay between the calls to ensureIndexVisible based on the slowest machines you need to support. You'll need to increase the delay to support slower machines which would take longer to render the rows after each call to the ensureIndexVisible API method.

summary: [clipboard/export] Allow to specify as source not only selected rows or range, but any rows/range
[Excel Export] Allow cellExcelStyle in the colDef
[Infinite Select] Create new Select that supports Infinite Scrolling
[Column Groups] Allow styling the edges of group cells
[Scrolling] Allow avoiding whitespace in the grid when only a few rows are shown while still using grid scrolling and row virtualization with many rows
moreInformation:
You can implement this by hosting AG Grid in a scrollable div container which sets max-height. AG Grid has to be configured with domLayout='autoHeight' so the grid fully expands and scrolling is handled by the container. As the vertical scrolling is handled by the container, this requires that horizontal scrolling is also handled by it. This is why the grid must set its width based on the total grid column width. This will fully render all the grid columns/rows inside the parent container which will be used for scrolling.

Note that the max-width and max-height for the grid container is set in the container class in index.html.

See this implemented here - click the buttons above the grid to set different row counts:
https://plnkr.co/edit/cfeqIYERPvb3sVXb?open=main.js

1/ Column header gets scrolled out of view when scrolling vertically
2/ Column header dragging (to reorder columns) to the right edge of the viewport doesn't scroll it horizontally the way it does when using AG Grid standard scrolling.
3/ Row dragging to the bottom edge of the viewport doesn't scroll it vertically the way it does when using AG Grid standard scrolling.

Use this approach and make your users aware of these limitations as that's the only way to implement this at this time.

Another option is to use pagination and to set the maxHeight by providing the pagination row count:
https://plnkr.co/edit/UU6SLEKVtIgb08Sp?open=main.js
